trustfund:
TF037202-YEMEN - FISHERIES IV,TF035586-MOROCCO - FISHERIES PROJECT AND
            GENERAL SECTOR WORKS,TF028316-GEF1-JORDAN GULF OF AQABA ENV.
            ACTION PLAN

abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the Gulf of
            Aqaba Environmental Action Plan Project is to enable Jordan
            to take the lead in establishing and implementing a regional
            collaborative framework for sustainable management and
            protection of the Gulf of Aqaba and the conservation of its
            unique coral reefs. Specific project objectives are to: 1)
            develop regional collaborative mechanisms for environmental
            management to strengthen capacity for the protection of the
            coastal zone and marine biodiversity; 2) develop and
            implement the legal framework and regulations for control of
            transboundary pollution; 3) provide for safeguards against
            oil pollution of aquifers and the marine environment; 4)
            establish and implement guidelines for the sustainable
            development of the coastal zone; 5) assess the effects of
            wastewater seepage on the quality and level of the
            transboundary groundwater table; 6) implement a plan to
            control transboundary solid waste impacts on the marine and
            coastal water resource systems; and 7) establish the
            Jordanian segment of the Red Sea Marine Peace Park. The
            project consists of the following components: 1) development
            of regulatory and institutional framework for Gulf of Aqaba
            environmental protection; 2) emergency assessment of oil
            pollution hazards and of pollutants contained in Ballast and
            Bilge water and measures to promote waste oil recovery and
            reuse; 3) safeguarding transboundary groundwater resources
            through groundwater monitoring and assessment of the effects
            of wastewater seepage on the quality and level of the
            groundwater table in the Gulf of Aqaba region; 4)
            development of an integral marine and land-based
            transboundary solid waste management strategy; and 5)
            protection of globally important coral reefs - development
            and implementation of the Jordanian Marine Park.
